get.description: Returns OK if the service is healthy and running

post.description: Retrieves the container ID where the meeting is currently hosted. Useful for monitoring and debugging.
Closes a consumer permanently, stopping the reception of media streams and freeing resources.
Closes a producer permanently, stopping the media stream and freeing resources.
Connects the consumer transport using DTLS parameters. This establishes the WebRTC transport connection for receiving media.
Connects the producer transport using DTLS parameters. This establishes the WebRTC transport connection for sending media.
Creates a new media consumer for a participant to receive audio/video streams from target participants in the meeting.
Creates a new meeting with the specified meeting ID and capacity. The capacity can be specified as overall meeting capacity, or separately as producer and consumer capacities.

400.description: Bad request - validation failed or invalid tenant

post.description: Creates a new media producer for a participant. This allows the participant to publish their audio/video stream to the meeting.
Ends a meeting permanently, closing all participants, producers, consumers, and freeing all associated resources.
Retrieves a list of all active producers (audio/video streams) in the specified meeting.
post.summary: Get all producers of a meeting

post.description: Retrieves the RTP (Real-time Transport Protocol) capabilities for a meeting, which are required for WebRTC negotiation.
Allows a participant to join an existing meeting. The system allocates producer and consumer router IDs for the participant.
Allows a participant to leave a meeting. This closes all their producers and consumers and frees associated resources.
Pauses a consumer temporarily, stopping the reception of media streams without closing it.
Pauses a producer temporarily, stopping the media stream from being published without closing it.
Retrieves pre-meeting details including router information for a participant before they join.
Recreates the consumer transport for a participant. This is useful when the transport connection needs to be re-established.
Recreates the producer transport for a participant. This is useful when the transport connection needs to be re-established.
Restarts the ICE (Interactive Connectivity Establishment) connection for the consumer transport. Used to recover from connection issues.
Restarts the ICE (Interactive Connectivity Establishment) connection for both producer and consumer transports of a participant.
Restarts the ICE (Interactive Connectivity Establishment) connection for the producer transport. Used to recover from connection issues.
Resumes a previously paused consumer, allowing the participant to receive media streams again.
Resumes a previously paused producer, allowing the participant to publish their media stream again.

target_participants.description: Map of target participant IDs to their consumer IDs to close

kinds.description: List of producer kinds to close (e.g., ["audio", "video"])

target_participants.description: Map of target participant IDs to their producer kinds to consume

consumer_meeting_capacity.description: Maximum number of participants who can consume (receive) media

producer_meeting_capacity.description: Maximum number of participants who can produce (send) media

rtp_parameters.description: RTP parameters for the media stream

start_recording.description: Whether to start recording this producer

instance_id.description: Instance identifier for the participant's client

target_participants.description: Map of target participant IDs to their consumer IDs to pause

kinds.description: List of producer kinds to pause (e.g., ["audio", "video"])

target_participants.description: Map of target participant IDs to their consumer IDs to resume

kinds.description: List of producer kinds to resume (e.g., ["audio", "video"])

container_id.description: Container identifier where the meeting is hosted
